meanings.definition: The position or role of an editor.
meanings.sent1: She aspired to one day hold multiple editorships at different magazines.
meanings.sent2: The editorships at the publishing house were highly sought after.
meanings.sent3: The editorships of the school newspaper were known for their strict deadlines.
meanings.sent4: In the world of journalism, editorships are like the captains of a ship, guiding the content.
meanings.sent5: His numerous editorships gave him a deep understanding of the publishing industry.

meanings.sent1: The editorships gathered for their annual conference to discuss industry trends.
meanings.sent2: The editorships of the magazine worked together seamlessly to produce the latest issue.
meanings.sent3: The editorships of the online platform formed a strong community of professionals.
meanings.sent4: The editorships, with their diverse backgrounds, brought unique perspectives to the table.
meanings.sent5: The editorships collaborated on a special edition that showcased their individual strengths.

meanings.definition: The term of office or tenure of an editor.
meanings.sent1: Her editorship lasted for five years before she decided to pursue other opportunities.
meanings.sent2: The editorship of the magazine was marked by innovative changes.
meanings.sent3: The editorship of the newspaper saw a significant increase in readership during his tenure.
meanings.sent4: His editorship was characterized by a commitment to journalistic integrity.
meanings.sent5: The editorship of the website brought fresh perspectives to online content creation.
